about_section_title.description: Title for the 'about' section of the options page

about_text_external.description: Content of the 'about' section on the external options page. The extension collects device information and sends it to our server
about_text_external.message: Endpoint Verification gathers and reports desktop machine status: screenlock state, disk encryption, hardware identifiers, os type/version.

about_text_internal.description: Content of the 'about' section on the internal options page. The extension collects device information and sends it to our server
about_text_internal.message: SecureConnect gathers and reports desktop machine status: screenlock state, disk encryption, hardware identifiers, os type/version.

add_account_button_text.description: Text for the Add Account button. Directs the user to a page where they can sign into a google account

consent_agree.description: Text shown on the agree button on the consent screen. The user agrees to the Google Privacy Policy.

consent_dismiss.description: Text shown on the dismiss button on the consent screen. This closes the consent screen and does not show it again.

consent_more_details.description: Continuation of the 'consent_text' message. 'Details' means more information regarding the Google Privacy Policy

consent_more_details_link.description: Continuation of the 'consent_more_details' message. It is separate because this text will be turned into a clickable link to a separate information page.

consent_reject.description: Test shown on the reject button on the consent screen. The user does not want to give consent to the Google Privacy Policy right now.

consent_text.description: First part of the consent message shown to the user. The full phrase is '... subject to the Google Privacy Policy.'
consent_text.message: Your enterprise administrator is installing Endpoint Verification on your device, subject to the

default_text.description: Text shown in the logging mode select, indicating it as the option which will be selected automatically

disabled_accounts_external.description: Text shown for the list of disabled accounts. Refers to accounts which the user is signed into but have not been enabled for SecureConnect by the domain administrator
disabled_accounts_external.message: These accounts are not enabled for Endpoint Verification

disabled_accounts_internal.description: Text shown for the list of disabled accounts. Refers to accounts which the user is signed into but have not been enabled for SecureConnect by the domain administrator
disabled_accounts_internal.message: These accounts are not enabled for SecureConnect

disabled_option.description: Text for the disabled mode select on the options page. This means that both enforcing and logging are turned off, and the extension will not interfere with accessing enterprise resources

download_logs.description: Text for a link that downloads the extension logs to the user's machine

enforcing_explanation.description: Explanation for the Enforcing mode select on the options page. 'The access' is access to enterprise resources and web pages
enforcing_explanation.message: The access is denied when the SecureConnect device information is incorrect or not present.

enforcing_option.description: Text for the enforcing mode select on the options page. 'Enforcing' in this context means that the extension is actively enforcing enterprise device policies, and will block access to enterprise resources if it decides the device is untrustworthy

explanation_external.description: Explanation of the extension shown to external users. The extension collects device information such as OS information (the operating system, os version number), identifiers (serial number, mac address), and the user using the device. This information is collected and may be viewed in the G Suite Admin Panel by a G Suite administrator
explanation_external.message: Endpoint Verification allows G Suite administrators to view laptop and desktop status, including: OS, Device, and User information.

explanation_internal.description: Explanation of the extension shown to internal users (googlers). The extension collects device information such as OS information (the operating system, os version number), identifiers (serial number, mac address), and the user using the device. This information is collected and may be viewed in the G Suite Admin Panel by a G Suite administrator
explanation_internal.message: SecureConnect allows G Suite administrators to view laptop and desktop status, including: OS, Device, and User information.

extension_description.description: Description of the extension that displays in the Chrome Webstore. Essentially the same as 'explanation_internal' message
extension_description.message: Allows G Suite administrators to view laptop and desktop status, including: OS, Device, and User information.

gaia_server_label.description: Label for the gaia server input on the options page

google_privacy_policy.description: The Google Privacy Policy, shown in the consent message.

google_server_label_external.description: Label for the google server input on the external options page

google_server_label_internal.description: Label for the google server input on the internal options page

last_sync_date.description: Text shown in popup when all accounts have synced at least once. Will be displayed along with a date: i.e. 'Last sync date: 07/24/2018 12:00:00'

learn_more_link.description: Text for the 'learn more' link in the about section on the options page. The link goes to a page where the user can get more information about the extension and what it does

logging_option.description: Text for the logging mode select on the options page. This means that our service will write to server-side logs if the device is not trusted, but will not actually block access to anything

native_helper_error_text.description: Text shown for NATIVE_HELPER_ERROR. 'Native helper' here and in other messages refers to a native binary that must be installed along with the extension in order for the extension to function properly. Synonymous terms for 'native helper' include 'native binary' and 'executable'. This error means that either the native helper has not been installed at all or has been installed incorrectly.
native_helper_error_text.message: The native helper is not present or hasn't been installed correctly.

native_helper_install_text.description: Text shown as a link. Continuation of the 'native_helper_error_text' message. 'It' here refers to the native helper

no_sync_date.description: Text shown in popup when some account has not been synced before

not_admin_installed_text.description: Text shown for NOT_ADMIN_INSTALLED. On ChromeOs devices only, the extension must be force installed on the device by the G Suite administrator who manages the device. See https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/6306504?hl=en for more context
not_admin_installed_text.message: This extension must be force installed on Chrome OS.

options_page_title_external.description: Title of the external version of the options page

options_page_title_internal.description: Title of the internal version of the options page

platform_keys_disabled_text.description: Text shown for PLATFORM_KEYS_DISABLED. 'Client certificates' and 'keys' here refer cryptographic keys and certificates used to establish secure internet connections. On ChromeOS devices, the extension requires a specific setting to be enabled in order to be able to use these
platform_keys_disabled_text.message: The extension needs access to client certificates and keys on Chrome OS.

settings_title.description: Title for the 'settings' section on the options page

signin_prompt_external.description: Text shown to external users when no accounts are logged in. Users must be signed in with a google account on a domain that has SecureConnect enabled (typically a work or school account)
signin_prompt_external.message: Endpoint Verification requires you to be logged into your work or school account.

signin_prompt_internal.description: Text shown to internal users when no accounts are logged in. Users must be signed in with a google account on a domain that has SecureConnect enabled (typically a work or school account)
signin_prompt_internal.message: SecureConnect requires you to be logged into your work or school account.

sync_button.description: Text on the sync button. 'Sync', both here and in other messages, refers to sending device information to our server

syncing_error_text.description: Text shown for SYNCING_ERROR. 'Sync' here means sending device information to our server. The message means that we were unable to send the information and will attempt to try again shortly
syncing_error_text.message: Failed to sync. A sync will be retried shortly.

title_external.description: The external name of the extension

title_internal.description: The internal (googlers-only) name of the extension

unsupported_platform_text.description: Text shown for UNSUPPORTED_PLATFORM. SecureConnect cannot run on the device because the OS is not supported. 'Platform' here is synonymous with 'OS'
